intro: Polyalthia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered polyalthia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, drooping branches and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has simple, opposite, elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. The flowers are pollinated by insects, and the tree produces small, round berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans.
